page.title: 13A School Day,Sellindge 1985
page.content: The school day starts at 9.00a.m.but most children are in the playground by 8.50a.m.After registration we usually go to the hall for assembly,but on Tuesday we have hymn practice and on Thursday we listen to a radio assembly in our classroom.The morning lessons are usually Maths,English,Reading or Music.We have lunch and a playtime from noon until 1p.m.,then the afternoon is given over to P.E.,Games, Art,Science,Project Work or completing the morning tasks.Some children have violin,viola or cello lessons.After school we have Recorder Groups,Soccer or Netball practices or games against other schools and Athletics.We have outings during the year to places of interest,theatres or musical events and we also have visits from theatre companies as well as cycle training and talks about road and rail safety.
